title: Which is the best course, DMLT or a BSc in MLT? - Quora

response.answer_text: BSc MLT indeed is good in the longer run. You'll have a bachelor's degree instead of a diploma certification. Even if you want to pursue a PG degree you'll need a bachelor's degree. BSc degree would cost you a year more than DMLT but it's good in the longer run as you can see in majority fields that the diploma graduates are being replaced by the bachelor graduates and the pay scale also varies.

By doing BSC medical lab technology, you become adept in preventing, diagnosing and treating illnesses by making use of clinical laboratory tests. It is an intensive three-year course that covers various aspects of testing and involves learning processes such as sampling, reporting, testing and documentation. Those who have completed 10th+ 12th Standard with a grade of 55% can apply for it. A diploma course in the same field is a shortened form of the degree course, covering most of its subjects and lasting for a period of two years. Both the Diploma and BSC medical lab technology course makes you ready for jobs such as health care administrator, laboratory assistant manager, medical content writing, molecular diagnostics professional etc.
